greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: "Binary potency" of n: length of shortest blocks of 0's inserted between the bits of n required to "dilute" it into a nonprime.
comment: Zero for all nonprime n. Note that the +2 dilution of 3 is not the +1 dilution of 5!
results.author: _Marc LeBrun_, Oct 10 2001
